ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ حَرِّقُوهُ وَٱنصُرُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ فَٰعِلِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Burn him and support your gods if you are resolved to do something.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They said: "Burn him, and save your gods, if you are men of action."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They said: "Burn him, and come to the support of your gods, if you are going to do anything."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "Burn him to ashes if you want to help your gods".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Burn him and help your Gods, if you want to.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Burn him and help your gods, if you will be doing."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: Burn him and help your gods, if you are going to do (anything).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Burn him, and help your gods, if you would do aught.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They said, "Burn him and help your deities, if you are resolved to do something."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: burn him, and succour your gods, if ye will be doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Burn him, and help your gods, if you are to do anything!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Burn him and help your aliha (gods), if you will be doing."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They said: 'Burn him and help your gods, if you are going to do anything'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Burn him and support your gods, if you are going to act.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:68] They said, ‘Burn him, that is, [burn] Abraham, and stand by your gods, by having him burnt, if you are to do anything’, in the way of standing by them. Thus they gathered lots of firewood and lit a fire throughout it. They then tied up Abraham, placed him in a ballista and had him hurled into the fire. God, exalted be He, says:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They cried) their king Nimrod said to them: (Burn him) in the Fire (and stand by your gods) and avenge your deities, (if ye will be doing) something to him; and they threw him in the Fire.
